resources.string: Enables Ambient Music in Pixel Ambient Services & adds mods to control it.\nImportant: You MUST have the Magisk module installed AS WELL for this to work.
Ambient Music Mod is running in the background. Tap to hide this notification in the system settings.
Keeps Ambient Music Mod running to periodically start recognition
The Ambient Music app must be launched manually after a reboot to allow the music model to start, tap to launch
Shows a helper notification after a reboot to remind you to start Ambient Music so recognition can start
For notification controls and Now Playing history
Launch Ambient Music Mod for more settings
You must enable the Xposed module for Ambient Music to work
Module is enabled and hooks are working

Xposed is not installed. Magisk alone is not enough for this mod to work, tap for more info.\nNote: If you have a repackaged or hidden Xposed Manager installed, you can ignore this and enable the module as normal.
Battery optimisation should be disabled for both Ambient Music Mod and Pixel Ambient Services for this mod to work properly
Manually start recognition to check input and amplification levels

Set how much the audio input should be amplified. Some devices have better microphones than others so may need less (or none at all), some need more.\nNote: Amplifying the input also amplifies noise, so a higher value is not always better.
Set how often Ambient Music should listen for music playing (default: never)
Listen for music playing when the device is woken
Show "Now Playing History" in your apps, rather than having to add a home screen shortcut
Show Now Playing on Lock Screen
Overlay the current Now Playing track on the lock screen. Requires an Accessibility Service.
Ambient Music detected that no music was playing
Audio is deleted after the Test Recognition dialog is closed

The saved file is in raw (PCM) format. You can open it in Audacity or similar programs by importing raw audio with the following settings:

- Signed 16-bit PCM
- Big-endian byte order
- 1 Channel (Mono)
- 16000Hz Sample Rate

If Ambient Music fails to start:

• Use the Launch Ambient Music App option to start the app, it may simply have been killed, then return to Ambient Music Mod and try again (this fixes it most of the time)
• Reboot your phone, but make sure to start Ambient Music before trying again as above
• Make sure you have "Android", "Pixel Ambient Services", "Ambient Music Mod" and "Device Personalisation Services" (if it's installed on your device) whitelisted in EdXposed, if you are using the app whitelist/Xposed Hide mode

If Ambient Music does not detect music playing:

• Adjust the amplification setting to make the sound loud, but not long enough that it's distorted. Use the "Play back input" option to listen back and adjust it as required
• Move closer to the speaker, you may simply be too far away
• Don't get too close to the speaker, very high volumes cause peaking and distortion that can prevent music being recognised

If Ambient Music says the input is not music:

• Make sure you have "Android", "Pixel Ambient Services" and "Ambient Music Mod" whitelisted in EdXposed.

The "Not Music" detection result is meant to happen Pixel devices with the official Ambient Music, but as the model is not optimised to tell the difference between "not music" and "no music" on other devices, it is disabled in this mod. If you see this response, it suggests the Xposed module is not working properly.

If Ambient Music returns an unknown response:\n\n• Make sure you are using the correct version of Pixel Ambient Services for the mod, and have not updated the app on Google Play or via another source. Only version 1.0.279736494 works with this mod.

If Ambient Music fails to respond:

• Use the Launch Ambient Music App option to start the app, it may simply have been killed, then return to Ambient Music Mod and try again (this fixes it most of the time)
• Reboot your phone, but make sure to start Ambient Music and wait a few minutes for the system to settle before trying again as above
• Make sure you have "Android", "Pixel Ambient Services", "Ambient Music Mod" and "Device Personalisation Services" (if it's installed on your device) whitelisted in EdXposed, if you are using the app whitelist/Xposed Hide mode
Run the music recognition on the little CPU cores. May save some battery, may be buggy (default: disabled).
Show album art from YouTube Music in Now Playing History. May be buggy.
Launch Google Assistant when the music recognition notification is clicked, rather than Google Search.\nChanges take effect on the next notification.
Advanced options such as core usage and custom amplification levels
Set a custom amplification level, if the standard option is still too low for your device. Use with caution, high amplification will also cause amplification of noise.

Display the current Now Playing track on the lock screen. Change position of the overlay in the Ambient Music Mod settings.

Important Note:
Ambient Music Mod does not collect or track any information from your device.
Overlay the current Now Playing track on the lock screen
Move the overlay around on the screen so it doesn\'t obstruct text or icons
Click on the overlay to ask Assistant for more info on a track
Ambient Music Mod\'s Accessibility Service needs to be enabled to use this feature. Tap to go Settings to enable it.
Create and install the module below
Unknown Sound Model compatibility (tap to check)
Sound Model compatible (tap to check again)
Sound Model incompatible (tap to check again)

The sound trigger driver version on your device (%1s) is below the minimum required version for this mod to work (%1s).
Important note: This CANNOT be fixed by a mod, or by flashing a different ROM. The driver is provided by your device\'s OEM, and is unlikely to be updated after the device is released.

The compatibility check of the Sound Model failed on your device. This is usually because the driver does not support it, or at least not the model in this mod. It may be supported in the future, check back later for future updates!

Your device does not have a compatible Sound Trigger platform (the software that loads sound trigger models), and therefore is unable to use this mod.\nImportant note: This CANNOT be fixed by a mod, or by flashing a different ROM. The platform is provided by your device\'s OEM, and is unlikely to be updated or changed after the device is released.

You do not have Xposed installed, and Xposed is required to use this mod. You can install Xposed via the Magisk App, by installing the Riru module and either EdXposed or LSposed modules.\nNote: If you are seeing this warning with Xposed installed and working, and you have the Xposed Manager app hidden, you can ignore it.

You need to have Xposed and Magisk installed to use this mod, it will not work with just Magisk.\nNote: If you plan to install Xposed later or have it installed but have hidden the Xposed Manager app, you can ignore this warning.
Pick where to save the built Magisk module
Install \"%1s\" in the Magisk App using the \"Install from Storage\" option
The module is already installed. Please disable or uninstall the module, reboot and try again.
The builder hit an unexpected error creating a modified XML, please try again.
Error zipping the module. Please try again.
Error copying the module. Please try again.
Battery optimisation should be disabled for both Ambient Music Mod and Pixel Ambient Services for this mod to work properly, disable them in the settings below

These options are for testing purposes only and may cause Ambient Music to break, degraded performance, higher battery usage or simply not work on your device. Tap to reset the settings to default and close.\nReboot for changes to take effect.
Dump Ambient related logs for debugging & reporting. Enable the Logging option and reboot first!
View & search a list of tracks Ambient Music can recognise
This is quite an intensive task and may take up to a few minutes. Once complete, it will be much faster to load until Ambient Music\'s databases next update.
Waiting for Ambient Music to respond…
Copying the databases, this may take up to a minute…
Parsing the databases, this may take a while…
No response from Ambient Music (try restarting both apps)
Ambient Music has a newer version of the music database than is cached in Ambient Music mod. Tap to update.

This option creates a zip of log files related to Sound Trigger & Ambient Music. Use it to report an issue on your device, ideally soon after rebooting (but launch the Ambient Music app and try a recognition first) or after a recent crash or error.

Please note that while error logs are useful to resolve bugs, the mod may not ever work on some devices.
The app will request root permissions as part of this process (required to access the system log). What\'s included in the log dump?

A log dump contains:

• Metadata on the installed version of Ambient Music Mod, Pixel Ambient Services, Device Personalization Services, the Magisk module, the Sound Trigger version on the device, whether Xposed and the Xposed module are installed
• A logcat, filtered on lines containing "sound_trigger" or "soundtrigger"
• A logcat, filtered on lines coming from Pixel Ambient Services
• A logcat, filtered on lines coming from Ambient Music Mod
• The sound_trigger_platform.xml file installed on your device

Please note: While the log dump shouldn't contain any personal information as the logs are filtered to apps and lines that shouldn't contain any personal info, there is no guarantee that they will not if another app is logging lines containing "soundtrigger" or "sound_trigger".
Error creating dump, please try again
Root access was not granted, please try again and check the Superuser settings in the Magisk app if the problem persists.
Read these before reporting issues or asking questions on the XDA thread or GitHub
Ambient Music Mod v%1s (%1s)\nCreated by Kieron Quinn / Quinny899 @ XDA

The version of Pixel Ambient Services installed on your device is newer than the version that works with Ambient Music Mod. Please uninstall updates for it in the app info or Ambient Music Mod will NOT work. Make sure to not update Pixel Ambient Services via the Play Store or other means, in order to not get this issue again, read the FAQ for more information.

A new update is available


Current version: %1s
New version: %1s
Update date: %1s
Changelog:
%1s
You may be asked to grant root permissions
Result code %1d\nIf you think this is an error, you can override the check and proceed anyway (but the mod may not work)
I understand the module may not work and I am proceeding at my own risk
Run the "Sound Model compatibility" check first before building!
